Abstract: The dataset represents the locations and attributes of Commission of fine arts review areas in Washington, DC 2005

    </citation>
    <descript>
      <abstract>The dataset represents the locations and attributes of Commission of fine arts review areas in Washington, DC 2005</abstract>
      <purpose>This data is used for the planning and management of Washington by local government agencies.</purpose>
      <supplinf>Depending upon the scope (i.e. a new building, major or minor alterations), a proposed project in areas defined in the Shipstead-Luce Act will be reviewed by the Commission of Fine Arts or by Commission staff. Staff reviews of smaller scale projects are compiled into an Appendix, which is submitted to the Commission members at each monthly meeting.</supplinf>
    </descript>
    <timeperd>
      <timeinfo>
        <sngdate>
          <caldate>01/19/07</caldate>
        </sngdate>
      </timeinfo>
      <current>publication date</current>
    </timeperd>
    <status>
      <progress>In work</progress>
      <update>As needed</update>
    </status>

      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Dataset copied from the CD obtained from Washington, DC 2005

In order to more accurately reflect written law, a modified "outer" Shipstead Luce boundary was created to include those properties that are directly in front of or adjacent to the original Shipstead-Luce Boundary.  The boundary information was validated by the U.S. Commission of Fine Arts.</procdesc>
        <procdate>2005</procdate>
